1839. [('43_Luk.003.021', 'Ἐγένετο', 'γίνομαι', 'It came to pass'), 5147]
Greek Text:
 Ἐγένετο δὲ ἐν τῷ βαπτισθῆναι ἅπαντα τὸν λαὸν καὶ Ἰησοῦ βαπτισθέντος καὶ προσευχομένου ἀνεῳχθῆναι τὸν οὐρανὸν

English Translation:
 It came to pass now in <the> baptizing all the people, and when Jesus having been baptized, and having prayed, [was] opening the heaven,

1840. [('47_1Co.011.004', 'Πᾶς', 'πᾶς', 'Every'), 5147]
Greek Text:
 Πᾶς ἀνὴρ προσευχόμενος ἢ προφητεύων κατὰ κεφαλῆς ἔχων καταισχύνει τὴν κεφαλὴν αὐτοῦ.

English Translation:
 Every man praying or prophesying, [anything] on [his] head having, dishonors the head of him.

1841. [('43_Luk.022.054', 'Συλλαβόντες', 'συλλαμβάνω', 'Having seized'), 5146]
Greek Text:
 Συλλαβόντες δὲ αὐτὸν ἤγαγον καὶ εἰσήγαγον αὐτὸν εἰς τὴν οἰκίαν τοῦ ἀρχιερέως. ὁ δὲ Πέτρος ἠκολούθει μακρόθεν.

English Translation:
 Having seized then Him, they led [Him] away, and led [Him] him into the home of the high priest. <the> And Peter was following afar off.

1842. [('41_Mat.002.006', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5145]
Greek Text:
 καὶ σὺ βηθλέεμ γῆ Ἰούδα, οὐδαμῶς ἐλαχίστη εἶ ἐν τοῖς ἡγεμόσιν Ἰούδα· ἐκ σοῦ γὰρ ἐξελεύσεται ἡγούμενος ὅστις ποιμανεῖ τὸν λαόν μου τὸν Ἰσραήλ.¶

English Translation:
 And you, Bethlehem, land of Judah, by no means least are among the rulers of Judah, out of you for will go forth [One] leading, who will shepherd the people of Me <the> Israel.’

1843. [('43_Luk.002.031', 'ὃ', 'ὅς, ἥ', 'which'), 5145]
Greek Text:
 ὃ ἡτοίμασας κατὰ πρόσωπον πάντων τῶν λαῶν,

English Translation:
 which You have prepared before [the] face of all the peoples,

1844. [('43_Luk.006.033', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5145]
Greek Text:
 καὶ γὰρ ἐὰν ἀγαθοποιῆτε τοὺς ἀγαθοποιοῦντας ὑμᾶς, ποία ὑμῖν χάρις ἐστίν; καὶ γὰρ οἱ ἁμαρτωλοὶ τὸ αὐτὸ ποιοῦσιν.

English Translation:
 And for if you shall do good to those doing good to you, what to you credit is it? For even for <the> sinners the same perform.

1845. [('47_1Co.011.006', 'εἰ', 'εἰ', 'If'), 5145]
Greek Text:
 εἰ γὰρ οὐ κατακαλύπτεται γυνή, καὶ κειράσθω· εἰ δὲ αἰσχρὸν γυναικὶ τὸ κείρασθαι ἢ ξυρᾶσθαι, κατακαλυπτέσθω.¶

English Translation:
 If for not covers her head a woman, also she should be shorn. If [it is] now disgraceful to a woman <the> to be shorn or to be shaven, she should cover her head.

1846. [('44_Jhn.003.022', 'Μετὰ', 'μετά', 'After'), 5144]
Greek Text:
 Μετὰ ταῦτα ἦλθεν ὁ Ἰησοῦς καὶ οἱ μαθηταὶ αὐτοῦ εἰς τὴν Ἰουδαίαν γῆν, καὶ ἐκεῖ διέτριβεν μετ᾽ αὐτῶν καὶ ἐβάπτιζεν.

English Translation:
 After these things came <the> Jesus and the disciples of Him into the Judean land, and there He was staying with them, and was baptizing.

1847. [('42_Mrk.003.033', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5143]
Greek Text:
 Καὶ ἀποκριθεὶς αὐτοῖς λέγει· τίς ἐστιν ἡ μήτηρ μου καὶ οἱ ἀδελφοί μου;

English Translation:
 And answering them, He says, Who are the mother of Me and the brothers of Me?

1848. [('45_Act.002.021', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5143]
Greek Text:
 καὶ ἔσται, πᾶς ὃς ἂν ἐπικαλέσηται τὸ ὄνομα κυρίου σωθήσεται.¶

English Translation:
 And it will be, everyone who when they shall call upon the name of [the] Lord will be saved.’

1849. [('53_1Th.003.012', 'ὑμᾶς', 'σύ', 'You'), 5143]
Greek Text:
 ὑμᾶς δὲ ὁ κύριος πλεονάσαι καὶ περισσεύσαι τῇ ἀγάπῃ εἰς ἀλλήλους καὶ εἰς πάντας καθάπερ καὶ ἡμεῖς εἰς ὑμᾶς

English Translation:
 You now, the Lord might make to increase, and might abound <the> in love toward one another, and toward all, just as also we toward you,

1850. [('44_Jhn.006.063', 'τὸ', 'ὁ', 'The'), 5142]
Greek Text:
 τὸ πνεῦμά ἐστιν τὸ ζῳοποιοῦν, ἡ σὰρξ οὐκ ὠφελεῖ οὐδέν· τὰ ῥήματα ἃ ἐγὼ λελάληκα ὑμῖν πνεῦμά ἐστιν καὶ ζωή ἐστιν.

English Translation:
 The Spirit is the [one] giving life; the flesh not profits anyone. The declarations that I have spoken to you spirit are, and life they are.

1851. [('51_Php.002.019', 'Ἐλπίζω', 'ἐλπίζω', 'I hope'), 5142]
Greek Text:
 Ἐλπίζω δὲ ἐν κυρίῳ Ἰησοῦ Τιμόθεον ταχέως πέμψαι ὑμῖν, ἵνα κἀγὼ εὐψυχῶ γνοὺς τὰ περὶ ὑμῶν·

English Translation:
 I hope however in [the] Lord Jesus, Timothy soon to send to you, that I also may be encouraged, having known the things concerning you.

1852. [('45_Act.003.014', 'ὑμεῖς', 'σύ', 'You'), 5141]
Greek Text:
 ὑμεῖς δὲ τὸν ἅγιον καὶ δίκαιον ἠρνήσασθε καὶ ᾐτήσασθε ἄνδρα φονέα χαρισθῆναι ὑμῖν,

English Translation:
 You however the Holy and Righteous One denied, and requested a man, a murderer, to be granted to you;

1853. [('43_Luk.002.045', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'and'), 5140]
Greek Text:
 καὶ μὴ εὑρόντες αὐτόν ὑπέστρεψαν εἰς Ἰερουσαλὴμ ἀναζητοῦντες αὐτόν.

English Translation:
 and not having found [Him], him they returned to Jerusalem, searching Him.

1854. [('53_1Th.002.017', 'Ἡμεῖς', 'ἐγώ', 'We'), 5140]
Greek Text:
 Ἡμεῖς δέ, ἀδελφοί, ἀπορφανισθέντες ἀφ᾽ ὑμῶν πρὸς καιρὸν ὥρας προσώπῳ οὐ καρδίᾳ, περισσοτέρως ἐσπουδάσαμεν τὸ πρόσωπον ὑμῶν ἰδεῖν ἐν πολλῇ ἐπιθυμίᾳ.

English Translation:
 We however, brothers, having been bereaved of you for [the] time of an hour, in face, not in heart, more abundantly were eager the face of you to see with great desire.

1855. [('41_Mat.011.002', 'Ὁ', 'ὁ', '<the>'), 5139]
Greek Text:
 Ὁ δὲ Ἰωάννης ἀκούσας ἐν τῷ δεσμωτηρίῳ τὰ ἔργα τοῦ Χριστοῦ, πέμψας διὰ τῶν μαθητῶν αὐτοῦ

English Translation:
 <the> And John, having heard in the prison the works of the Christ, having sent on account of of the disciples of him,

1856. [('41_Mat.002.003', 'Ἀκούσας', 'ἀκούω', 'Having heard'), 5138]
Greek Text:
 Ἀκούσας δὲ ὁ βασιλεὺς Ἡρῴδης ἐταράχθη καὶ πᾶσα Ἱεροσόλυμα μετ᾽ αὐτοῦ,

English Translation:
 Having heard then <the> King Herod, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

1857. [('45_Act.004.024', 'οἱ', 'ὁ', '<the>'), 5138]
Greek Text:
 οἱ δὲ ἀκούσαντες ὁμοθυμαδὸν ἦραν φωνὴν πρὸς τὸν θεὸν καὶ εἶπαν· δέσποτα, σὺ ὁ θεὸς ὁ ποιήσας τὸν οὐρανὸν καὶ τὴν γῆν καὶ τὴν θάλασσαν καὶ πάντα τὰ ἐν αὐτοῖς,

English Translation:
 <the> And having heard, with one accord they lifted up [their] voice to <the> God and said, Sovereign Lord, You <the> God who made the heaven, and the earth, and the sea, and all that [is] in them,

1858. [('48_2Co.008.015', 'καθὼς', 'καθώς', 'As'), 5138]
Greek Text:
 καθὼς γέγραπται· ὁ τὸ πολὺ οὐκ ἐπλεόνασεν καὶ ὁ τὸ ὀλίγον οὐκ ἠλαττόνησεν.¶

English Translation:
 As it has been written: He the much not did abound, and he the little not lacked.”

1859. [('50_Eph.003.018', 'ἵνα', 'ἵνα', 'so that'), 5136]
Greek Text:
 ἵνα ἐξισχύσητε καταλαβέσθαι σὺν πᾶσιν τοῖς ἁγίοις τί τὸ πλάτος καὶ μῆκος καὶ ὕψος καὶ βάθος,

English Translation:
 so that you may be fully able to comprehend with all the saints what [is] the breadth and length and height and depth,

1860. [('43_Luk.024.006', 'οὐκ', 'οὐ', 'Not'), 5135]
Greek Text:
 οὐκ ἔστιν ὧδε ἀλλ᾽ ἠγέρθη· μνήσθητε ὡς ἐλάλησεν ὑμῖν ἔτι ὢν ἐν τῇ Γαλιλαίᾳ

English Translation:
 Not He is here, but He is risen! do remember how He spoke to you, yet being in <the> Galilee,

1861. [('45_Act.016.028', 'Ἐφώνησεν', 'φωνέω', 'Called out'), 5135]
Greek Text:
 Ἐφώνησεν δὲ μεγάλῃ φωνῇ ὁ Παῦλος λέγων· μηδὲν πράξῃς σεαυτῷ κακόν· ἅπαντες γάρ ἐσμεν ἐνθάδε.

English Translation:
 Called out however in a loud voice, <the> Paul saying, Not may do to yourself harm; all for we are here.

1862. [('53_1Th.004.007', 'οὐ', 'οὐ', 'Not'), 5134]
Greek Text:
 οὐ γὰρ ἐκάλεσεν ἡμᾶς ὁ θεὸς ἐπὶ ἀκαθαρσίᾳ ἀλλ᾽ ἐν ἁγιασμῷ.

English Translation:
 Not for has called us <the> God to impurity, but into holiness.

1863. [('44_Jhn.006.036', 'ἀλλ᾽', 'ἀλλά', 'But'), 5133]
Greek Text:
 ἀλλ᾽ εἶπον ὑμῖν ὅτι καὶ ἑωράκατέ με καὶ οὐ πιστεύετε.

English Translation:
 But I said to you that also you have seen Me, and yet not believe.

1864. [('47_1Co.010.029', 'συνείδησιν', 'συνείδησις', '[the] conscience'), 5133]
Greek Text:
 συνείδησιν δὲ λέγω οὐχὶ τὴν ἑαυτοῦ ἀλλὰ τὴν τοῦ ἑτέρου. ἱνατί γὰρ ἡ ἐλευθερία μου κρίνεται ὑπὸ ἄλλης συνειδήσεως;

English Translation:
 [the] conscience now, I am saying, not <the> your own, but that of the other; so why for the freedom of me is judged by another’s conscience?

1865. [('43_Luk.012.004', 'Λέγω', 'λέγω', 'I say'), 5132]
Greek Text:
 Λέγω δὲ ὑμῖν τοῖς φίλοις μου· μὴ φοβηθῆτε ἀπὸ τῶν ἀποκτεινόντων τὸ σῶμα καὶ μετὰ ταῦτα μὴ ἐχόντων περισσότερόν τι ποιῆσαι.

English Translation:
 I say now to you, those friends of Me, not you may fear because of those killing the body and after these things not being able more abundantly anything to do.

1866. [('45_Act.011.019', 'Οἱ', 'ὁ', 'Those'), 5132]
Greek Text:
 Οἱ μὲν οὖν διασπαρέντες ἀπὸ τῆς θλίψεως τῆς γενομένης ἐπὶ Στεφάνῳ διῆλθον ἕως Φοινίκης καὶ Κύπρου καὶ Ἀντιοχείας μηδενὶ λαλοῦντες τὸν λόγον εἰ μὴ μόνον Ἰουδαίοις.¶

English Translation:
 Those indeed therefore having been scattered by the tribulation <the> having taken place over Stephen, passed through to Phoenicia, and Cyprus, and Antioch, to no one speaking the word except only solely to Jews.

1867. [('41_Mat.018.035', 'οὕτως', 'οὕτω, οὕτως', 'Thus'), 5131]
Greek Text:
 οὕτως καὶ ὁ πατήρ μου ὁ οὐράνιος ποιήσει ὑμῖν ἐὰν μὴ ἀφῆτε ἕκαστος τῷ ἀδελφῷ αὐτοῦ ἀπὸ τῶν καρδιῶν ὑμῶν τὰ παραπτώματα αὐτῶν.¶

English Translation:
 Thus also the Father of Me <the> heavenly will do to you, only unless you may forgive each the brother of him, from the heart of you the trespasses of them.

1868. [('46_Rom.002.025', 'Περιτομὴ', 'περιτομή', 'Circumcision'), 5131]
Greek Text:
 Περιτομὴ μὲν γὰρ ὠφελεῖ ἐὰν νόμον πράσσῃς· ἐὰν δὲ παραβάτης νόμου ᾖς, ἡ περιτομή σου ἀκροβυστία γέγονεν.

English Translation:
 Circumcision indeed for profits, if [the] law you shall do; if however a transgressor of law you shall be, the circumcision of you uncircumcision has become.

1869. [('45_Act.005.042', 'πᾶσάν', 'πᾶς', 'Every'), 5130]
Greek Text:
 πᾶσάν τε ἡμέραν ἐν τῷ ἱερῷ καὶ κατ᾽ οἶκον οὐκ ἐπαύοντο διδάσκοντες καὶ εὐαγγελιζόμενοι τὸν χριστὸν Ἰησοῦν.¶

English Translation:
 Every then day, in the temple and in house, not they were ceasing teaching and proclaiming the good news that the Christ [is] Jesus.

1870. [('46_Rom.016.016', 'ἀσπάσασθε', 'ἀσπάζομαι', 'do greet'), 5130]
Greek Text:
 ἀσπάσασθε ἀλλήλους ἐν φιλήματι ἁγίῳ.¶ ἀσπάζονται ὑμᾶς αἱ ἐκκλησίαι πᾶσαι τοῦ Χριστοῦ.¶

English Translation:
 do greet one another with a kiss holy. Greet you, the churches all <the> of Christ.

1871. [('43_Luk.023.012', 'ἐγένοντο', 'γίνομαι', 'Became'), 5129]
Greek Text:
 ἐγένοντο δὲ φίλοι ὅ τε Ἡρῴδης καὶ ὁ Πιλᾶτος ἐν αὐτῇ τῇ ἡμέρᾳ μετ᾽ ἀλλήλων· προϋπῆρχον γὰρ ἐν ἔχθρᾳ ὄντες πρὸς αὐτούς.¶

English Translation:
 Became then friends <the> both Herod and <the> Pilate on that <the> day with one another; they were formerly for at enmity they were between themselves.

1872. [('41_Mat.005.026', 'ἀμὴν', 'ἀμήν', 'Amen'), 5127]
Greek Text:
 ἀμὴν λέγω σοι· οὐ μὴ ἐξέλθῃς ἐκεῖθεν ἕως ἂν ἀποδῷς τὸν ἔσχατον κοδράντην.¶

English Translation:
 Amen I say to you, no not you may come out from there, until when you may pay the last kodranten!

1873. [('43_Luk.022.019', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5127]
Greek Text:
 Καὶ λαβὼν ἄρτον εὐχαριστήσας ἔκλασεν καὶ ἔδωκεν αὐτοῖς λέγων· τοῦτό ἐστιν τὸ σῶμά μου τὸ ὑπὲρ ὑμῶν διδόμενον· τοῦτο ποιεῖτε εἰς τὴν ἐμὴν ἀνάμνησιν.

English Translation:
 And having taken [the] bread, having given thanks, He broke [it] and gave to them, saying, This is the body of Me, which for you is given; this do perform in the of Me remembrance,

1874. [('42_Mrk.007.018', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5126]
Greek Text:
 καὶ λέγει αὐτοῖς· οὕτως καὶ ὑμεῖς ἀσύνετοί ἐστε; οὐ νοεῖτε ὅτι πᾶν τὸ ἔξωθεν εἰσπορευόμενον εἰς τὸν ἄνθρωπον οὐ δύναται αὐτὸν κοινῶσαι;

English Translation:
 And He says to them, Thus also you without understanding are? Not understand you that everything <the> from outside entering into the man, not is able him to defile,

1875. [('45_Act.013.017', 'ὁ', 'ὁ', 'The'), 5126]
Greek Text:
 ὁ θεὸς τοῦ λαοῦ τούτου Ἰσραὴλ ἐξελέξατο τοὺς πατέρας ἡμῶν καὶ τὸν λαὸν ὕψωσεν ἐν τῇ παροικίᾳ ἐν γῇ Αἰγύπτου καὶ μετὰ βραχίονος ὑψηλοῦ ἐξήγαγεν αὐτοὺς ἐξ αὐτῆς·

English Translation:
 The God of the people this of Israel chose the fathers of us, and the people exalted in the sojourn in [the] land of Egypt, and with arm uplifted, brought them out of it,

1876. [('50_Eph.003.017', 'κατοικῆσαι', 'κατοικέω', '[for] to dwell'), 5126]
Greek Text:
 κατοικῆσαι τὸν Χριστὸν διὰ τῆς πίστεως ἐν ταῖς καρδίαις ὑμῶν ἐν ἀγάπῃ ἐρριζωμένοι καὶ τεθεμελιωμένοι,

English Translation:
 [for] to dwell <the> Christ through <the> faith in the hearts of you, in love rooted and founded,

1877. [('46_Rom.011.018', 'μὴ', 'μή', 'not'), 5125]
Greek Text:
 μὴ κατακαυχῶ τῶν κλάδων· εἰ δὲ κατακαυχᾶσαι, οὐ σὺ τὴν ῥίζαν βαστάζεις ἀλλ᾽ ἡ ῥίζα σέ.

English Translation:
 not do boast over the branches. If now you boast against [them], not you the root support, but the root you.

1878. [('59_Heb.011.039', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5123]
Greek Text:
 Καὶ οὗτοι πάντες μαρτυρηθέντες διὰ τῆς πίστεως οὐκ ἐκομίσαντο τὴν ἐπαγγελίαν

English Translation:
 And these all, having been commended through the faith, not did receive the promise,

1879. [('67_Rev.020.012', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5122]
Greek Text:
 καὶ εἶδον τοὺς νεκρούς, τοὺς μεγάλους καὶ τοὺς μικρούς, ἑστῶτας ἐνώπιον τοῦ θρόνου, καὶ βιβλία ἠνοίχθησαν. καὶ ἄλλο βιβλίον ἠνοίχθη ὅ ἐστιν τῆς ζωῆς. καὶ ἐκρίθησαν οἱ νεκροὶ ἐκ τῶν γεγραμμένων ἐν τοῖς βιβλίοις κατὰ τὰ ἔργα αὐτῶν.

English Translation:
 And I saw the dead, <the> great and <the> small, standing before the throne, and books were opened. And another book was opened, which is the [one] of life. And were judged the dead out of the things written in the books, according to the deeds of them.

1880. [('48_2Co.001.010', 'ὃς', 'ὅς, ἥ', 'who'), 5121]
Greek Text:
 ὃς ἐκ τηλικούτου θανάτου ἐρρύσατο ἡμᾶς καὶ ῥύσεται εἰς ὃν ἠλπίκαμεν ὅτι καὶ ἔτι ῥύσεται

English Translation:
 who from such a great a death has delivered us, and will deliver [us], in whom we have hope that also still He will deliver [us],

1881. [('44_Jhn.002.025', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'and'), 5120]
Greek Text:
 καὶ ὅτι οὐ χρείαν εἶχεν ἵνα τις μαρτυρήσῃ περὶ τοῦ ἀνθρώπου· αὐτὸς γὰρ ἐγίνωσκεν τί ἦν ἐν τῷ ἀνθρώπῳ.¶

English Translation:
 and because no need He had that anyone may testify concerning the man; He Himself for was knowing what was in the man.

1882. [('44_Jhn.003.019', 'αὕτη', 'οὗτος', 'This'), 5120]
Greek Text:
 αὕτη δέ ἐστιν ἡ κρίσις ὅτι τὸ φῶς ἐλήλυθεν εἰς τὸν κόσμον, καὶ ἠγάπησαν οἱ ἄνθρωποι μᾶλλον τὸ σκότος ἢ τὸ φῶς· ἦν γὰρ αὐτῶν πονηρὰ τὰ ἔργα.

English Translation:
 This now is the judgement, that the Light has come into the world, and loved <the> men rather the darkness than the Light; were for of them evil the deeds.

1883. [('44_Jhn.006.041', 'Ἐγόγγυζον', 'γογγύζω', 'Were grumbling'), 5120]
Greek Text:
 Ἐγόγγυζον οὖν οἱ Ἰουδαῖοι περὶ αὐτοῦ ὅτι εἶπεν· ἐγώ εἰμι ὁ ἄρτος ὁ καταβὰς ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ·

English Translation:
 Were grumbling therefore the Jews about Him because He said, I am the bread <the> having come down from <the> heaven.

1884. [('45_Act.003.020', 'ὅπως', 'ὅπως', 'so that'), 5120]
Greek Text:
 ὅπως ἂν ἔλθωσιν καιροὶ ἀναψύξεως ἀπὸ προσώπου τοῦ κυρίου καὶ ἀποστείλῃ τὸν προκεχειρισμένον ὑμῖν χριστὸν Ἰησοῦν

English Translation:
 so that maybe may come times of refreshing from [the] presence of the Lord, and [that] He may send the [One] appointed to you, Christ Jesus,

1885. [('52_Col.003.002', 'τὰ', 'ὁ', 'The things'), 5120]
Greek Text:
 τὰ ἄνω φρονεῖτε μὴ τὰ ἐπὶ τῆς γῆς.

English Translation:
 The things above do set [your] minds on, not the things on the earth.

1886. [('67_Rev.001.003', 'μακάριος', 'μακάριος', 'blessed [is]'), 5120]
Greek Text:
 μακάριος ὁ ἀναγινώσκων καὶ οἱ ἀκούοντες τοὺς λόγους τῆς προφητείας καὶ τηροῦντες τὰ ἐν αὐτῇ γεγραμμένα· ὁ γὰρ καιρὸς ἐγγύς.¶

English Translation:
 blessed [is] the [one] reading, and those hearing the words of the prophecy, and keeping the things in it written; <the> for the time [is] near.

1887. [('43_Luk.004.044', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5119]
Greek Text:
 καὶ ἦν κηρύσσων εἰς τὰς συναγωγὰς τῆς Ἰουδαίας.¶

English Translation:
 And He was preaching in the synagogues <the> of Judea.

1888. [('43_Luk.007.019', 'ἔπεμψεν', 'πέμπω', 'sent [them]'), 5119]
Greek Text:
 ἔπεμψεν πρὸς τὸν κύριον λέγων· σὺ εἶ ὁ ἐρχόμενος, ἢ ἄλλον προσδοκῶμεν;¶

English Translation:
 sent [them] to the Lord, saying, You are the coming [One], or another are we to look for?

1889. [('50_Eph.005.015', 'Βλέπετε', 'βλέπω', 'do take heed'), 5118]
Greek Text:
 Βλέπετε οὖν ἀκριβῶς πῶς περιπατεῖτε μὴ ὡς ἄσοφοι ἀλλ᾽ ὡς σοφοί,

English Translation:
 do take heed therefore carefully how you walk, not as unwise, but as wise,

1890. [('43_Luk.001.049', 'ὅτι', 'ὅτι', 'For'), 5117]
Greek Text:
 ὅτι ἐποίησέν μοι μεγάλα ὁ δυνατός· καὶ ἅγιον τὸ ὄνομα αὐτοῦ·

English Translation:
 For has done to me great [things] the Mighty One. And holy [is] the name of Him.

1891. [('67_Rev.005.007', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5117]
Greek Text:
 καὶ ἦλθεν καὶ εἴληφεν τὸ βιβλίον ἐκ τῆς δεξιᾶς τοῦ καθημένου ἐπὶ τοῦ θρόνου.

English Translation:
 And He came and has taken <the> scroll out of the right hand of the [One] sitting on the throne.

1892. [('41_Mat.007.027', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5116]
Greek Text:
 καὶ κατέβη ἡ βροχὴ καὶ ἦλθον οἱ ποταμοὶ καὶ ἔπνευσαν οἱ ἄνεμοι, καὶ προσέκοψαν τῇ οἰκίᾳ ἐκείνῃ, καὶ ἔπεσεν· καὶ ἦν ἡ πτῶσις αὐτῆς μεγάλη.¶

English Translation:
 And came down the rain, and came the torrents, and blew the winds, and beat that house upon, and it fell — and was the fall of it great.

1893. [('59_Heb.012.013', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'and'), 5116]
Greek Text:
 καὶ τροχιὰς ὀρθὰς ποιεῖτε τοῖς ποσὶν ὑμῶν, ἵνα μὴ τὸ χωλὸν ἐκτραπῇ, ἰαθῇ δὲ μᾶλλον.

English Translation:
 and paths straight do make for the feet of you, so that not the lame may be put out of joint, may be healed however rather.

1894. [('41_Mat.011.013', 'πάντες', 'πᾶς', 'All'), 5115]
Greek Text:
 πάντες γὰρ οἱ προφῆται καὶ ὁ νόμος ἕως Ἰωάννου ἐπροφήτευσαν.

English Translation:

1895. [('45_Act.004.031', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5114]
Greek Text:

English Translation:
 And when were praying they, was shaken the place in which they were assembled, and they were filled all with the Holy Spirit and were speaking the word <the> of God with boldness.

English Translation:

1897. [('42_Mrk.005.039', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5112]
Greek Text:

English Translation:
 And having entered, He says to them, Why make you commotion and weep? The child not is dead, but sleeps.

1898. [('60_Jas.005.002', 'ὁ', 'ὁ', 'The'), 5112]

English Translation:
 The riches of You have rotted, and the garments of you moth-eaten have become.

1899. [('41_Mat.007.007', 'Αἰτεῖτε,', 'αἰτέω', 'do ask'), 5111]

English Translation:
 do ask and it will be given to you; do seek and you will find; do knock and it will be opened to you.

 Having gone out now, the Pharisees a counsel held against Him, how Him they may destroy.

English Translation:
 everything for which is becoming visible light is. Therefore it says: do awake, you who [are] sleeping, and do rise up out from the dead, and will shine upon you <the> Christ.

1902. [('42_Mrk.015.020', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5109]
Greek Text:

English Translation:
 And when they had mocked Him, they took off him the purple and put on Him the garments His And they are leading out him, that they may crucify Him.

1903. [('43_Luk.011.051', 'ἀπὸ', 'ἀπό', 'from'), 5108]
Greek Text:
 ἀπὸ τοῦ αἵματος Ἅβελ ἕως τοῦ αἵματος Ζαχαρίου τοῦ ἀπολομένου μεταξὺ τοῦ θυσιαστηρίου καὶ τοῦ οἴκου. ναὶ λέγω ὑμῖν, ἐκζητηθήσεται ἀπὸ τῆς γενεᾶς ταύτης.¶

English Translation:
 from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, the [one] having perished between the altar and the house. Yes, I say to you, it will be required of <the> generation this.

1904. [('44_Jhn.017.011', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5108]
Greek Text:
 καὶ οὐκέτι εἰμὶ ἐν τῷ κόσμῳ, καὶ αὐτοὶ ἐν τῷ κόσμῳ εἰσίν, κἀγὼ πρὸς σὲ ἔρχομαι.¶ Πάτερ ἅγιε, τήρησον αὐτοὺς ἐν τῷ ὀνόματί σου ᾧ δέδωκάς μοι ἵνα ὦσιν ἓν καθὼς καὶ ἡμεῖς.

English Translation:
 And no longer I am in the world, and yet themselves in the world they are, and I to You am coming. Father Holy, do keep them in the name of You, which [name] You have given to Me, that they may be one as and we [are].

1905. [('45_Act.021.021', 'κατηχήθησαν', 'κατηχέω', 'They have been informed'), 5108]
Greek Text:
 κατηχήθησαν δὲ περὶ σοῦ ὅτι ἀποστασίαν διδάσκεις ἀπὸ Μωϋσέως τοὺς κατὰ τὰ ἔθνη πάντας Ἰουδαίους λέγων μὴ περιτέμνειν αὐτοὺς τὰ τέκνα μηδὲ τοῖς ἔθεσιν περιπατεῖν.

English Translation:
 They have been informed now about you, that apostasy you teach, from Moses, those among the Gentiles all Jews, telling not to circumcise them the children, nor in the customs to walk.

 Again now I say to you, easier for [it] is a camel through [the] an eye of a needle to go through, than a rich man to enter into the kingdom of <the> God.

 And having recognized the voice <the> of Peter, from <the> joy not she opened the gate, having run in; but she reported to have been standing <the> Peter before the gate.

 And he having cried out said, Father Abraham, do have mercy on me and do send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of the finger of him in water and may cool the tongue of me; for I am suffering in <the> flame this.

 I said then, What shall I do, Lord? <the> And the Lord said to me, Having risen up do go to Damascus, and there you it will be told concerning all things that it has been appointed you to do.

 He said then to them, Not yours it is to know times or seasons which the Father put in place by <the> His own authority.

1929. [('41_Mat.005.013', 'Ὑμεῖς', 'σύ', 'You'), 5095]

English Translation:
 You are the salt of the earth; if, however, the salt shall become tasteless, with what will it be salted. For nothing it is useful any longer, except only for being cast out, and is to be trampled upon by <the> men.

English Translation:
 Himself for David said by the Spirit <the> Holy: Said the Lord to the Lord of me, do sit at [the] right hand of Me, until when I may place of the enemies of You [as] a footstool of the feet of You.”’

 When therefore you may do acts of charity, not may sound a trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, so that they may have glory from <the> men. Amen I say to you, they have the reward of them.

 εἴ γε ἠκούσατε τὴν οἰκονομίαν τῆς χάριτος τοῦ θεοῦ τῆς δοθείσης μοι εἰς ὑμᾶς

 If indeed you have heard of the administration of the grace <the> of God, which having been given to me toward you,

 saying to them, It has been written: And will be the house of Me a house of prayer.’ You however it made a den of robbers.’

1942. [('45_Act.004.032', 'Τοῦ', 'ὁ', '<the>'), 5089]

English Translation:
 <the> And the multitude who having believed were [in] <the> heart and <the> soul one, and not one anything of that which belonged to him, was claiming [his] own to be, but were to them all things in common.

1943. [('46_Rom.003.020', 'διότι', 'διότι', 'Therefore'), 5089]
Greek Text:
 διότι ἐξ ἔργων νόμου οὐ δικαιωθήσεται πᾶσα σὰρξ ἐνώπιον αὐτοῦ· διὰ γὰρ νόμου ἐπίγνωσις ἁμαρτίας.

English Translation:
 Therefore by works of [the] Law not will be justified any flesh before Him; through for [the] Law [is] knowledge of sin.

1944. [('41_Mat.002.012', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5088]
Greek Text:
 καὶ χρηματισθέντες κατ᾽ ὄναρ μὴ ἀνακάμψαι πρὸς Ἡρῴδην, δι᾽ ἄλλης ὁδοῦ ἀνεχώρησαν εἰς τὴν χώραν αὐτῶν.¶

English Translation:
 And having been divinely warned in a dream not to return to Herod, by another route they withdrew into the country of them.

1945. [('41_Mat.009.011', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5088]
Greek Text:
 καὶ ἰδόντες οἱ Φαρισαῖοι ἔλεγον τοῖς μαθηταῖς αὐτοῦ· διὰ τί μετὰ τῶν τελωνῶν καὶ ἁμαρτωλῶν ἐσθίει ὁ διδάσκαλος ὑμῶν;

English Translation:
 And having seen [it], the Pharisees was saying to the disciples of Him, Because of why with the tax collectors and sinners eats the Teacher of you?

1946. [('43_Luk.022.055', 'περιαψάντων', 'περιάπτω', 'They having kindled around'), 5088]
Greek Text:
 περιαψάντων δὲ πῦρ ἐν μέσῳ τῆς αὐλῆς καὶ συγκαθισάντων αὐτῶν ἐκάθητο ὁ Πέτρος ἐν μέσος αὐτῶν.

English Translation:
 They having kindled around then a fire in [the] midst of the courtyard, and when having sat down together, they, was sitting <the> Peter in midst them.

1947. [('67_Rev.017.009', 'ὧδε', 'ὧδε', 'Here [is]'), 5088]
Greek Text:
 ὧδε ὁ νοῦς ὁ ἔχων σοφίαν. αἱ ἑπτὰ κεφαλαὶ ἑπτὰ ὄρη εἰσίν, ὅπου ἡ γυνὴ κάθηται ἐπ᾽ αὐτῶν. καὶ βασιλεῖς ἑπτά εἰσιν·

English Translation:
 Here [is] the mind which is having wisdom: The seven heads, seven mountains are, where the woman sits on them. And kings seven there are.

1948. [('43_Luk.021.005', 'Καί', 'καί', 'And'), 5087]
Greek Text:
 Καί τινων λεγόντων περὶ τοῦ ἱεροῦ ὅτι λίθοις καλοῖς καὶ ἀναθήμασιν κεκόσμηται εἶπεν·

English Translation:
 And as some were speaking about the temple, that with stones goodly and with consecrated gifts it has been adorned, He said,

1949. [('59_Heb.013.005', 'Ἀφιλάργυρος', 'ἀφιλάργυρος', '[Let be] without covetousness'), 5084]
Greek Text:
 Ἀφιλάργυρος ὁ τρόπος· ἀρκούμενοι τοῖς παροῦσιν· αὐτὸς γὰρ εἴρηκεν· οὐ μή σε ἀνῶ, οὐδ᾽ οὐ μή σε ἐγκαταλίπω·

English Translation:
 [Let be] without covetousness <the> [your] manner of life, being satisfied with the present; He Himself for has said: Never not you shall I leave, nor never not you shall I forsake.”

1950. [('45_Act.018.007', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5083]
Greek Text:
 Καὶ μεταβὰς ἐκεῖθεν εἰσῆλθεν εἰς οἰκίαν τινὸς ὀνόματι Τιτίου Ἰούστου σεβομένου τὸν θεόν, οὗ ἡ οἰκία ἦν συνομοροῦσα τῇ συναγωγῇ.

English Translation:
 And having departed from there he entered to [the] house of a certain one named Titius Justus, worshiping the God, of whom the house was adjoining to the synagogue.

English Translation:
 We love him because He first loved us.

1952. [('41_Mat.003.017', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5082]
Greek Text:
 καὶ ἰδοὺ φωνὴ ἐκ τῶν οὐρανῶν λέγουσα· οὗτός ἐστιν ὁ υἱός μου ὁ ἀγαπητὸς ἐν ᾧ εὐδόκησα.¶

English Translation:
 And behold, a voice out of the heavens, saying, This is the Son of me, the beloved, in whom I was well pleased.

1953. [('43_Luk.011.045', 'Ἀποκριθεὶς', 'ἀποκρίνω', 'Answering'), 5082]
Greek Text:
 Ἀποκριθεὶς δέ τις τῶν νομικῶν λέγει αὐτῷ· διδάσκαλε, ταῦτα λέγων καὶ ἡμᾶς ὑβρίζεις.¶

English Translation:
 Answering now, one of the lawyers says to Him, Teacher, these things saying, also us You insult.

1954. [('43_Luk.007.006', 'Ὁ', 'ὁ', '<the>'), 5080]
Greek Text:
 Ὁ δὲ Ἰησοῦς ἐπορεύετο σὺν αὐτοῖς. ἤδη δὲ αὐτοῦ οὐ μακρὰν ἀπέχοντος ἀπὸ τῆς οἰκίας ἔπεμψεν πρὸς αὐτὸν φίλους ὁ ἑκατοντάρχης λέγων αὐτῷ· κύριε, μὴ σκύλλου· οὐ γὰρ ἱκανός εἰμι ἵνα ὑπὸ τὴν στέγην μου εἰσέλθῃς,

English Translation:
 <the> And Jesus was going with them. Already then, when he not far being distant from the house, sent to him friends the centurion, saying to Him, Lord, not do be troubled, not for worthy I am that under the roof of me You may come;

1955. [('67_Rev.008.002', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5080]

English Translation:
 And I saw the seven angels who before <the> God have stood, and were given to them seven trumpets.

1956. [('67_Rev.019.001', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'and'), 5080]
Greek Text:
 Καὶ μετὰ ταῦτα ἤκουσα ὡς φωνὴν μεγάλην ὄχλου πολλοῦ ἐν τῷ οὐρανῷ λεγόντων· ἁλληλουϊά· ἡ σωτηρία καὶ ἡ δόξα καὶ ἡ τιμὴ καὶ ἡ δύναμις κυρίῳ τοῦ θεοῦ ἡμῶν,

English Translation:
 and After these things I heard [something] like a voice loud of a multitude great in <the> heaven, crying out: Hallelujah! The salvation and the glory and <the> honor and the power Lord <the> God of us!

1957. [('41_Mat.010.034', 'Μὴ', 'μή', 'Not'), 5079]
Greek Text:
 Μὴ νομίσητε ὅτι ἦλθον βαλεῖν εἰρήνην ἐπὶ τὴν γῆν· οὐκ ἦλθον βαλεῖν εἰρήνην ἀλλὰ μάχαιραν.

English Translation:
 Not may you think that I came to bring peace to the earth; not I came to bring peace, but a sword.

1958. [('44_Jhn.011.031', 'Οἱ', 'ὁ', 'The'), 5079]
Greek Text:
 Οἱ οὖν Ἰουδαῖοι οἱ ὄντες μετ᾽ αὐτῆς ἐν τῇ οἰκίᾳ καὶ παραμυθούμενοι αὐτήν, ἰδόντες τὴν Μαριὰμ ὅτι ταχέως ἀνέστη καὶ ἐξῆλθεν, ἠκολούθησαν αὐτῇ, δόξαντες ὅτι ὑπάγει εἰς τὸ μνημεῖον ἵνα κλαύσῃ ἐκεῖ.

English Translation:
 The then Jews who are being with her in the house and consoling her, having seen <the> Mary that quickly she rose up and went out, followed after her, having supposed that she is going to the tomb that she may weep there.

English Translation:
 An angel however of [the] Lord, during the night having opened the doors of the prison, having brought out then them, said,

English Translation:
 And the peace <the> of God which is surpassing all understanding will guard the hearts of you and the minds of you in Christ Jesus.

Greek Text:
 τί γάρ ἐστιν εὐκοπώτερον· εἰπεῖν· ἀφίενταί σου αἱ ἁμαρτίαι, ἢ εἰπεῖν· ἔγειρε καὶ περιπάτει;

English Translation:

English Translation:
 Behold, is left to you the house of you. desolate Amen I say now to you, that no not shall you see Me until when [the time] will come when you may say, Blessed [is] the [One] coming in [the] name of [the] Lord.’

 And being grieved the king, on account of now the oaths and those reclining with [him], he commanded [it] to be given.

1964. [('42_Mrk.006.004', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5076]

 Καὶ ἔλεγεν αὐτοῖς ὁ Ἰησοῦς ὅτι οὐκ ἔστιν προφήτης ἄτιμος εἰ μὴ ἐν τῇ πατρίδι αὐτοῦ καὶ ἐν τοῖς συγγενεῦσιν αὐτοῦ καὶ ἐν τῇ οἰκίᾳ αὐτοῦ.

English Translation:
 And was saying to them <the> Jesus that, Not is a prophet without honor, except only in the hometown of him, and among the relatives of him, and in the household of him.

Greek Text:
 Ἦν δὲ ἐν τῷ τόπῳ ὅπου ἐσταυρώθη κῆπος καὶ ἐν τῷ κήπῳ μνημεῖον καινὸν ἐν ᾧ οὐδέπω οὐδεὶς ἦν τεθειμένος.

English Translation:
 There was now in the place where He was crucified a garden, and in the garden a tomb new, in which not yet no one was [already] laid.

 ὁσάκις γὰρ ἐὰν ἐσθίητε τὸν ἄρτον τοῦτον καὶ τὸ ποτήριον τοῦτο πίνητε, τὸν θάνατον τοῦ κυρίου καταγγέλλετε ἄχρι οὗ ἂν ἔλθῃ.¶

English Translation:
 As often as for when you shall eat <the> bread this, and <the> cup this may drink, the death of the Lord you proclaim until that when He may come.

 Πᾶσα πικρία καὶ θυμὸς καὶ ὀργὴ καὶ κραυγὴ καὶ βλασφημία ἀρθήτω ἀφ᾽ ὑμῶν σὺν πάσῃ κακίᾳ.

English Translation:
 All bitterness, and rage, and anger, and clamor, and slander, should be removed from you, along with all malice.

English Translation:
 They were weeping now all and were mourning for her. <the> But He said, Not do weep; not for she is dead, but sleeps.

1974. [('43_Luk.002.020', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5071]

Greek Text:
 ἐξ οὗ πᾶν τὸ σῶμα συναρμολογούμενον καὶ συμβιβαζόμενον διὰ πάσης ἁφῆς τῆς ἐπιχορηγίας κατ᾽ ἐνέργειαν ἐν μέτρῳ ἑνὸς ἑκάστου μέρους τὴν αὔξησιν τοῦ σώματος ποιεῖται εἰς οἰκοδομὴν ἑαυτοῦ ἐν ἀγάπῃ.¶

English Translation:
 from whom all the body, being joined together and being held together by every ligament of [its] supply, according to [the] working in [the] measure individual of each part, the increase of the body makes for itself to [the] building up of itself in love.

English Translation:
 [This] one however thing not should be hidden from you, beloved, that one day with [the] Lord [is] like a thousand years, and a thousand years like day one.

English Translation:
 And out of the mouth of Him goes forth a sword two-edged sharp, so that with it He may strike down the nations; and He will shepherd them with a rod of iron. And He treads the press of the wine of the fury and of the wrath <the> of God the Almighty.

1985. [('47_1Co.007.016', 'τί', 'τίς', 'How'), 5063]

English Translation:

1986. [('67_Rev.011.013', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5063]

English Translation:
 And in that [very] <the> hour there was an earthquake great, and a tenth of the city fell, and were killed in the earthquake, names of men thousand seven. And the rest terrified became and gave glory to the God <the> of heaven.

1987. [('67_Rev.014.006', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5063]

 Καὶ εἶδον ἄλλον ἄγγελον πετόμενον ἐν μεσουρανήματι ἔχοντα εὐαγγέλιον αἰώνιον εὐαγγελίσαι ἐπὶ τοὺς καθημένους ἐπὶ τῆς γῆς καὶ ἐπὶ πᾶν ἔθνος καὶ φυλὴν καὶ γλῶσσαν καὶ λαὸν

English Translation:
 And I saw another angel flying in mid-heaven, having [the] glad tidings everlasting to preach upon those residing on the earth, and to every nation and tribe and tongue and people,

1988. [('59_Heb.003.008', 'μὴ', 'μή', 'not'), 5062]

English Translation:
 not shall harden the hearts of you, as in the rebellion, in the day <the> of testing in the wilderness,

 They asked therefore him, Who is the man <the> having said to you, do take up the mat of you and do walk?’

 Συνίστημι δὲ ὑμῖν Φοίβην τὴν ἀδελφὴν ἡμῶν οὖσαν καὶ διάκονον τῆς ἐκκλησίας τῆς ἐν Κεγχρεαῖς,

1992. [('41_Mat.028.018', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5059]

 Καὶ προσελθὼν ὁ Ἰησοῦς ἐλάλησεν αὐτοῖς λέγων· ἐδόθη μοι πᾶσα ἐξουσία ἐν οὐρανῷ καὶ ἐπὶ τῆς γῆς.

English Translation:
 And having come to [them], <the> Jesus spoke to them, saying, Has been given to Me all authority in heaven and on the earth.

1993. [('46_Rom.007.013', 'τὸ', 'ὁ', 'That which'), 5059]
Greek Text:
 τὸ οὖν ἀγαθὸν ἐμοὶ ἐγένετο θάνατος; μὴ γένοιτο, ἀλλ᾽ ἡ ἁμαρτία, ἵνα φανῇ ἁμαρτία, διὰ τοῦ ἀγαθοῦ μοι κατεργαζομένη θάνατον, ἵνα γένηται καθ᾽ ὑπερβολὴν ἁμαρτωλὸς ἡ ἁμαρτία διὰ τῆς ἐντολῆς.¶

English Translation:
 That which then [is] good, to me became death? Never might it be! But <the> sin, in order that it may be shown to be sin, through that which [is] good to me is working out death; so that may become beyond excess sinful, <the> sin through the commandment.

1994. [('41_Mat.021.039', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 5058]
Greek Text:
 καὶ λαβόντες αὐτὸν ἐξέβαλον ἔξω τοῦ ἀμπελῶνος καὶ ἀπέκτειναν.

English Translation:
 And having taking him, they cast [him] out of the vineyard and killed [him].

English Translation:

 ἐλεύσονται δὲ ἡμέραι, καὶ ὅταν ἀπαρθῇ ἀπ᾽ αὐτῶν ὁ νυμφίος, τότε νηστεύσουσιν ἐν ἐκείναις ταῖς ἡμέραις.

English Translation:
 Will come however days also when may be taken away from them the bridegroom; then they will fast in those <the> days.

2096. [('42_Mrk.011.019', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4997]
Greek Text:
 Καὶ ὅταν ὀψὲ ἐγένετο, ἐξεπορεύοντο ἔξω τῆς πόλεως.

English Translation:
 And when evening came, they were going out of the city.

2097. [('43_Luk.018.011', 'ὁ', 'ὁ', 'The'), 4997]
Greek Text:
 ὁ Φαρισαῖος σταθεὶς πρὸς ἑαυτὸν ταῦτα προσηύχετο· ὁ θεός, εὐχαριστῶ σοι ὅτι οὐκ εἰμὶ ὥσπερ οἱ λοιποὶ τῶν ἀνθρώπων, ἅρπαγες, ἄδικοι, μοιχοί, ἢ καὶ ὡς οὗτος ὁ τελώνης.

English Translation:
 The Pharisee, having stood, toward himself these things was praying, O God, I thank You that not I am like the rest of the men — swindlers, unrighteous, adulterers — or even like this <the> tax collector.

2098. [('44_Jhn.006.011', 'ἔλαβεν', 'λαμβάνω', 'Took'), 4997]
Greek Text:
 ἔλαβεν οὖν τοὺς ἄρτους ὁ Ἰησοῦς καὶ εὐχαριστήσας διέδωκεν τοῖς μαθηταῖς οἱ δὲ μαθηταὶ τοῖς ἀνακειμένοις, ὁμοίως καὶ ἐκ τῶν ὀψαρίων ὅσον ἤθελον.

English Translation:
 Took then the loaves <the> Jesus, and having given thanks, He distributed to the disciples; <the> now the disciples, to those reclining; likewise also of the fish, as much as they were wishing

2099. [('45_Act.011.023', 'ὃς', 'ὅς, ἥ', 'who'), 4997]
Greek Text:
 ὃς παραγενόμενος καὶ ἰδὼν τὴν χάριν τὴν τοῦ θεοῦ ἐχάρη καὶ παρεκάλει πάντας τῇ προθέσει τῆς καρδίας προσμένειν ἐν τῷ κυρίῳ·

English Translation:
 who having come and having seen the grace which [is] <the> of God, rejoiced and was exhorting all <the> with resolute purpose <the> of heart to abide in the Lord.

2100. [('44_Jhn.021.008', 'οἱ', 'ὁ', '<the>'), 4996]
Greek Text:
 οἱ δὲ ἄλλοι μαθηταὶ τῷ πλοιαρίῳ ἦλθον· οὐ γὰρ ἦσαν μακρὰν ἀπὸ τῆς γῆς ἀλλ᾽ ὡς ἀπὸ πηχῶν διακοσίων σύροντες τὸ δίκτυον τῶν ἰχθύων.¶

English Translation:
 <the> And the other disciples in the boat came, not for were they far from the land, but about away cubits two hundred, dragging the net with the fish.

2101. [('44_Jhn.008.018', 'ἐγώ', 'ἐγώ', 'I'), 4995]

 ἐγώ εἰμι ὁ μαρτυρῶν περὶ ἐμαυτοῦ, καὶ μαρτυρεῖ περὶ ἐμοῦ ὁ πέμψας με πατήρ.

English Translation:
 I am the [One] bearing witness concerning Myself, and bears witness concerning Me the having sent Me Father.

2102. [('61_1Pe.003.014', 'ἀλλ᾽', 'ἀλλά', 'But'), 4994]
Greek Text:
 ἀλλ᾽ εἰ καὶ πάσχοιτε διὰ δικαιοσύνην, μακάριοι. τὸν δὲ φόβον αὐτῶν μὴ φοβηθῆτε μηδὲ ταραχθῆτε·

English Translation:
 But if even you might suffer because of righteousness, [you are] blessed. <the> And the threats of them not shall you be afraid of, neither shall you be troubled.”

2103. [('41_Mat.023.010', 'μηδὲ', 'μηδέ', 'Neither'), 4992]
Greek Text:
 μηδὲ κληθῆτε καθηγηταί, ὅτι ὁ καθηγητὴς ὑμῶν ἐστιν εἷς, ὁ Χριστός.

English Translation:
 Neither may be called instructors, since the instructor of you is One, the Christ.

2104. [('67_Rev.002.016', 'μετανόησον', 'μετανοέω', 'do repent'), 4992]
Greek Text:
 μετανόησον οὖν· εἰ δὲ μή, ἔρχομαί σοι ταχὺ καὶ πολεμήσω μετ᾽ αὐτῶν ἐν τῇ ῥομφαίᾳ τοῦ στόματός μου.

English Translation:
 do repent therefore! If however not, I am coming to you quickly, and I will make war against them with the sword of the mouth of Me.

2105. [('42_Mrk.001.042', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4991]

English Translation:

2106. [('42_Mrk.012.031', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'and'), 4991]

English Translation:

2108. [('46_Rom.013.011', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4990]
Greek Text:
 Καὶ τοῦτο εἰδότες τὸν καιρόν, ὅτι ὥρα ἤδη ὑμᾶς ἐξ ὕπνου ἐγερθῆναι· νῦν γὰρ ἐγγύτερον ἡμῶν ἡ σωτηρία ἢ ὅτε ἐπιστεύσαμεν·

English Translation:
 And this, already knowing the time, that [it is the] hour already [for] you out of sleep to awaken; now for nearer [is] of us the salvation than when first we believed.

English Translation:

English Translation:

English Translation:
 The God and Father of the Lord of us Jesus Christ knows, who is being blessed to the ages, that not I am lying.

 They indeed therefore were departing rejoicing, from [the] presence of the Council, that they had been counted worthy for the Name <the> of him to suffer dishonor.

 The greeting <the> in my own hand — by Paul, which is [my] sign in every letter. In this manner I write.

 reproof however he had for his own transgression [by] a donkey mute; in a man’s voice having spoken, it restrained the of the prophet madness.

 Such indeed for us also was fitting a high priest, holy, innocent, undefiled, separated from <the> sinners, and higher than the heavens having become,

 Said therefore to them <the> Jesus, Amen, Amen, I say to you, not Moses has given you the bread from <the> heaven, but the Father of Me gives you the bread from <the> heaven <the> true.

 and the rest, some indeed on boards, some however on things <the> from the ship. And thus it came to pass that all being saved to the land.

2128. [('44_Jhn.009.006', 'ταῦτα', 'οὗτος', 'These things'), 4981]

2144. [('42_Mrk.003.032', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4972]

 Again therefore were asking him also the Pharisees how he had received sight. <the> And he said to them, Clay He put of me on the eyes, and I washed, and I see.

2146. [('45_Act.028.003', 'συστρέψαντος', 'συστρέφω', 'When having gathered'), 4971]

English Translation:
 When having gathered now <the> Paul, of sticks a quantity, and having laid [them] on the fire, a viper out from the heat having come, fastened on the hand of him.

2147. [('60_Jas.005.004', 'ἰδοὺ', 'ἰδού', 'Behold,'), 4971]
Greek Text:

English Translation:
 Behold, the wage of the workmen who having harvested the fields of you, which kept back by you, cries out, and the cries of those having harvested, into the ears of [the] Lord of Hosts have entered.

2148. [('46_Rom.008.029', 'ὅτι', 'ὅτι', 'For'), 4970]
Greek Text:

English Translation:

English Translation:
 <the> and the disciples, having seen Him on the sea walking, were troubled, saying that, A ghost it is! And in <the> fear they cried out.

 Then says to them <the> Jesus, Not do fear. do go, do tell to the brothers, of Me so that they may go into <the> Galilee, and there Me will they see.

 I exhort now you, brothers, do bear with the word <the> of exhortation; only for in few words I have written to you.

 To the [one] striking you on the cheek, do offer also the other; and from the [one] taking away your <the> cloak, also the tunic not may do withhold.

2194. [('42_Mrk.006.031', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4943]
Greek Text:
 καὶ λέγει αὐτοῖς· δεῦτε ὑμεῖς αὐτοὶ κατ᾽ ἰδίαν εἰς ἔρημον τόπον καὶ ἀναπαύσασθε ὀλίγον· ἦσαν γὰρ οἱ ἐρχόμενοι καὶ οἱ ὑπάγοντες πολλοί, καὶ οὐδὲ φαγεῖν εὐκαίρουν.¶

English Translation:
 And He speaks to them, Come you yourselves apart [your] own to [a] solitary place, and do rest a little. Were for those coming and those going [are] many, and not even to eat were they able.

2195. [('44_Jhn.009.036', 'ἀπεκρίθη', 'ἀποκρίνω', 'Answered'), 4942]
Greek Text:
 ἀπεκρίθη ἐκεῖνος καὶ εἶπεν· καὶ τίς ἐστιν, κύριε, ἵνα πιστεύσω εἰς αὐτόν;

English Translation:

2196. [('41_Mat.027.008', 'διὸ', 'διό', 'Therefore'), 4941]

 διὸ ἐκλήθη ὁ ἀγρὸς ἐκεῖνος ἀγρὸς αἵματος ἕως τῆς σήμερον.¶

English Translation:
 Therefore was called the field that, Field of Blood, to <the> this day.

2197. [('47_1Co.016.024', 'ἡ', 'ὁ', 'The'), 4940]
Greek Text:

English Translation:
 The love of Me [be] with all you in Christ Jesus. Amen to Corinthians first it was written from Philippi, through of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus and Timothy

2198. [('67_Rev.018.017', 'ὅτι', 'ὅτι', 'Since'), 4940]
Greek Text:
 ὅτι μιᾷ ὥρᾳ ἠρημώθη ὁ τοσοῦτος πλοῦτος.¶ Καὶ πᾶς κυβερνήτης καὶ πᾶς ὁ ἐπὶ τόπον τῶν πλέων ὁ ὅμιλος καὶ ναῦται καὶ ὅσοι τὴν θάλασσαν ἐργάζονται ἀπὸ μακρόθεν ἔστησαν

English Translation:
 Since in one hour has been brought to desolation <the> such great wealth. And every shipmaster, and all those to a place of the sailing, <the> multitudes and sailors, and as many as the sea trade by, at a distance stood,

2199. [('52_Col.001.018', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4939]
Greek Text:

English Translation:
 And He is the head of the body, the church, who is the beginning, firstborn out from the dead, so that may be in all things He holding preeminence,

2200. [('42_Mrk.004.008', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4937]
Greek Text:
 καὶ ἄλλα ἔπεσεν εἰς τὴν γῆν τὴν καλὴν καὶ ἐδίδου καρπὸν ἀναβαίνοντα καὶ αὐξανόμενα καὶ ἔφερεν ἓν τριάκοντα καὶ ἓν ἑξήκοντα καὶ ἓν ἑκατόν.

English Translation:
 And others fell into the soil <the> good, and was yielding fruit, growing up and increasing, and was bearing one thirtyfold, and one sixty, and one a hundred.

2201. [('44_Jhn.001.001', 'Ἐν', 'ἐν', 'In [the]'), 4937]

2202. [('41_Mat.005.020', 'λέγω', 'λέγω', 'I say'), 4936]
Greek Text:
 λέγω γὰρ ὑμῖν ὅτι ἐὰν μὴ περισσεύσῃ ὑμῶν ἡ δικαιοσύνη πλεῖον τῶν γραμματέων καὶ Φαρισαίων, οὐ μὴ εἰσέλθητε εἰς τὴν βασιλείαν τῶν οὐρανῶν.¶

English Translation:
 I say for to you, that only unless shall abound your <the> righteousness above [that] of the scribes and Pharisees, no not shall you enter into the kingdom of the heavens.

2203. [('41_Mat.019.029', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4935]
Greek Text:
 Καὶ πᾶς ὅστις ἀφῆκεν οἰκίας ἢ ἀδελφοὺς ἢ ἀδελφὰς ἢ πατέρα ἢ μητέρα ἢ γυναῖκα ἢ τέκνα ἢ ἀγροὺς ἕνεκεν τοῦ ὀνόματός μου, ἑκατονταπλασίονα λήμψεται καὶ ζωὴν αἰώνιον κληρονομήσει.¶

English Translation:
 And everyone who has left houses, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife or children, or lands, for the sake of <the> name, My a hundredfold will receive, and life eternal will inherit.

Greek Text:
 στελλόμενοι τοῦτο, μή τις ἡμᾶς μωμήσηται ἐν τῇ ἁδρότητι ταύτῃ τῇ διακονουμένῃ ὑφ᾽ ἡμῶν·

English Translation:
 avoiding this, lest anyone us may blame in <the> abundance this which is being administered by us.

2205. [('67_Rev.006.008', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4934]
Greek Text:
 καὶ εἶδον καὶ ἰδοὺ ἵππος χλωρὸς καὶ ὁ καθήμενος ἐπάνω αὐτοῦ ὄνομα αὐτῷ ὁ θάνατος. καὶ ὁ ᾅδης ἠκολούθει μετ᾽ αὐτοῦ. καὶ ἐδόθη αὐτοῖς ἐξουσία ἐπὶ τὸ τέταρτον τῆς γῆς ἀποκτεῖναι ἐν ῥομφαίᾳ καὶ ἐν λιμῷ καὶ ἐν θανάτῳ καὶ ὑπὸ τῶν θηρίων τῆς γῆς.¶

English Translation:
 And I looked, and behold, a horse pale, and the [one] sitting on it, [the] name of him [was] <the> Death, and <the> Hades was following with him; and was given to them authority over the fourth of the earth, to kill with sword, and with famine, and with plague, and by the beasts of the earth.

Greek Text:
 εἶπεν δέ τις αὐτῷ· ἰδοὺ ἡ μήτηρ σου καὶ οἱ ἀδελφοί σου ἔξω ἑστήκασιν ζητοῦντές σοι λαλῆσαι.

English Translation:

English Translation:

English Translation:
 And behold, an earthquake there was great; an angel for of [the] Lord, having descended out of heaven, and having come, rolled away the stone from <the> door and was sitting upon it.

English Translation:
 And they had seen some of the disciples of Him that with defiled hands, That is unwashed, are eating the bread. fault

Greek Text:
 πλὴν ἐν τούτῳ μὴ χαίρετε ὅτι τὰ πνεύματα ὑμῖν ὑποτάσσεται· χαίρετε δὲ μᾶλλον ὅτι τὰ ὀνόματα ὑμῶν ἐγγέγραπται ἐν τοῖς οὐρανοῖς.¶

English Translation:
 Yet in this not do rejoice, that the spirits to you are subjected; do rejoice however more that the names of you have been written in the heavens.

English Translation:
 No one is able two masters to serve; either for the one he will hate, and the other he will love; or to [the] one he will be devoted, and the other he will despise. Not you are able God to serve, and money.

 Amen, Amen, I say to you, if anyone <the> My word <the> shall keep, death never not shall he see, to the age.

2240. [('67_Rev.004.006', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4907]
Greek Text:
 καὶ ἐνώπιον τοῦ θρόνου ὡς θάλασσα ὑαλίνη, ὁμοία κρυστάλλῳ, καὶ ἐν μέσῳ τοῦ θρόνου καὶ κύκλῳ τοῦ θρόνου τέσσαρα ζῷα γέμοντα ὀφθαλμῶν ἔμπροσθεν καὶ ὄπισθεν.

English Translation:
 Thus I say to you, there is joy before the angels <the> of God over one sinner repenting.

2245. [('60_Jas.001.002', 'Πᾶσαν', 'πᾶς', 'All'), 4903]

English Translation:
 All joy do esteem [it], brothers of me, when trials you may fall into various,

2246. [('43_Luk.007.002', 'ἑκατοντάρχου', 'ἑκατόνταρχος', 'Of a centurion'), 4902]
Greek Text:

English Translation:
 Of a centurion then a certain servant, sick being, was about to die, who was to him valued highly.

2248. [('46_Rom.003.004', 'μὴ', 'μή', 'Never'), 4901]
Greek Text:
 μὴ γένοιτο.¶ Γινέσθω δὲ ὁ θεὸς ἀληθής, πᾶς δὲ ἄνθρωπος ψεύστης καθὼς γέγραπται· ὅπως ἂν δικαιωθῇς ἐν τοῖς λόγοις σου καὶ νικήσεις ἐν τῷ κρίνεσθαί σε.¶

English Translation:
 Never might it be! should it be however <the> God true, every now man a liar, as it has been written: That then You may be justified in the words of You, and will prevail in <the> being judged Your.”

Greek Text:
 ὑμῖν δὲ λέγω τοῖς λοιποῖς τοῖς ἐν Θυατείροις, ὅσοι οὐκ ἔχουσιν τὴν διδαχὴν ταύτην, καὶ οἵτινες οὐκ ἔγνωσαν τὰ βαθέα τοῦ σατανᾶ ὡς λέγουσιν· οὐ βάλλω ἐφ᾽ ὑμᾶς ἄλλο βάρος,

English Translation:
 To you however I say, to [the] rest of those in Thyatira, as many as not have <the> teaching this, and who not have known the deeps <the> of Satan, as they say: Not I do cast upon you any other burden.

Greek Text:
 ἄλλους ἔσωσεν, ἑαυτὸν οὐ δύναται σῶσαι. εἰ βασιλεὺς Ἰσραήλ ἐστιν, καταβάτω νῦν ἀπὸ τοῦ σταυροῦ, καὶ πιστεύσομεν ἐπ᾽ αὐτόν.

English Translation:
 Others He saved. Himself not is He able to save. if King of Israel He is. he should descend now from the cross, and we will believe in Him.

2252. [('41_Mat.002.016', 'Τότε', 'τότε', 'Then'), 4899]

English Translation:
 Then Herod, having seen that he had been outwitted by the Magi, was enraged intensely, and having sent forth, he put to death all the boys that [were] in Bethlehem and in all the vicinity of it, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had ascertained from the Magi.

English Translation:
 They took away therefore the stone. where was who having died laid <the> Now Jesus lifted <the> [His] eyes upwards and said, Father, I thank You that You have heard Me.

 And having seen <the> Jesus the faith of them, He says to the paralytic, Son, are forgiven of you the sins. of you

 having commanded then to the centurion to keep <the> him, to [let him] have then ease, and not to forbid the private [friends] of him to minister or to come near to him.

 Reported then the jailer <the> words these to <the> Paul that: Have sent the captains, that you may be let go. Now therefore having gone out, do depart in peace.

 <the> but to sit at [the] right hand of Me or at [the] left hand, of me not is Mine to give, but [to those] for whom it has been prepared.

English Translation:
 No one for anything in secret does and seeks himself in public to be. If these things You do, do show Yourself to the world.

2290. [('45_Act.014.017', 'καίτοι', 'καί+τοι', 'and yet'), 4877]

English Translation:
 and yet not without witness Himself He has left, doing good, from heaven to you rains giving and seasons fruitful, filling with food and gladness the hearts of you.

2291. [('44_Jhn.018.021', 'τί', 'τίς', 'Why'), 4876]
Greek Text:

English Translation:
 Why Me do you ask? do ask those having heard what I spoke to them; behold, they know what said I.

2292. [('62_2Pe.001.004', 'δι᾽', 'διά', 'through'), 4876]
Greek Text:
 δι᾽ ὧν τὰ τίμια καὶ μέγιστα ἡμῖν ἐπαγγέλματα δεδώρηται, ἵνα διὰ τούτων γένησθε θείας κοινωνοὶ φύσεως ἀποφυγόντες τῆς ἐν τῷ κόσμῳ ἐν ἐπιθυμίᾳ φθορᾶς.

English Translation:
 through which the precious and magnificent to us promises He has himself given, so that through these you may become of [the] divine partakers nature, having escaped the in the world in desire, decay.

2293. [('42_Mrk.002.015', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4875]
Greek Text:

English Translation:
 And it came to pass, in the reclining of Him in the house of him, that many tax collectors and sinners were reclining with <the> Jesus and with the disciples of Him; there were for many, and they were following Him.

2294. [('44_Jhn.009.004', 'ἡμᾶς', 'ἐγώ', 'Us'), 4875]
Greek Text:
 ἡμᾶς δεῖ ἐργάζεσθαι τὰ ἔργα τοῦ πέμψαντός με ἕως ἡμέρα ἐστίν· ἔρχεται νύξ, ὅτε οὐδεὶς δύναται ἐργάζεσθαι.

English Translation:
 Us it behooves to work the works of the [One who] having sent Me, while day it is; is coming night, when no one is able to work.

2295. [('44_Jhn.006.046', 'οὐχ', 'οὐ', 'Not'), 4874]
Greek Text:
 οὐχ ὅτι τὸν πατέρα ἑώρακέν τις εἰ μὴ ὁ ὢν παρὰ τοῦ θεοῦ, οὗτος ἑώρακεν τὸν πατέρα.¶

English Translation:
 Not that the Father has seen anyone, except only the [One] being from <the> God; He has seen the Father.

2296. [('43_Luk.015.026', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4872]
Greek Text:
 καὶ προσκαλεσάμενος ἕνα τῶν παίδων αὐτοῦ ἐπυνθάνετο τί ἂν εἴη ταῦτα.¶

English Translation:

2297. [('43_Luk.024.025', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4872]
Greek Text:

English Translation:
 And He said to them, O foolish and slow <the> of heart <the> to believe in all that spoke the prophets.

 Of this [man] the God, of the seed, according to promise, has brought <the> to Israel [the] Savior Jesus —

English Translation:
 It has been written for: Live I, says [the] Lord, that to Me will bow every knee, and every tongue will confess <the> to God.”

2301. [('41_Mat.018.008', 'εἰ', 'εἰ', 'If'), 4871]
Greek Text:
 εἰ δὲ ἡ χείρ σου ἢ ὁ πούς σου σκανδαλίζει σε, ἔκκοψον αὐτὸν καὶ βάλε ἀπὸ σοῦ· καλόν σοί ἐστιν εἰσελθεῖν εἰς τὴν ζωὴν κυλλὸν ἢ χωλὸν ἢ δύο χεῖρας ἢ δύο πόδας ἔχοντα βληθῆναι εἰς τὸ πῦρ τὸ αἰώνιον.

English Translation:
 If now the hand of you or the foot of you causes to sin you, do cut off it and do cast [it] from you; better for you it is to enter into <the> life crippled or lame, than two hands or two feet having, to be cast into the fire <the> eternal.

2302. [('41_Mat.027.030', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4870]

 He commanded now them in the name of Jesus Christ to be baptized. <the> Lord Then they asked him to remain days some.

Greek Text:
 Ζηλώσαντες δὲ οἱ ἀπειθοῦντες οἱ Ἰουδαῖοι καὶ προσλαβόμενοι τῶν ἀγοραίων ἄνδρας τινὰς πονηροὺς καὶ ὀχλοποιήσαντες ἐθορύβουν τὴν πόλιν, καὶ ἐπιστάντες τῇ οἰκίᾳ Ἰάσονος ἐζήτουν αὐτοὺς προαγαγεῖν εἰς τὸν δῆμον·

English Translation:
 Having become jealous now <the> being disobedient the Jews, and having taken to [them] of the market-loungers men certain wicked, and having collected a crowd, they were setting in uproar the city; and having assailed the house of Jason, they were seeking them to bring out to the people.

2305. [('59_Heb.009.024', 'οὐ', 'οὐ', 'Not'), 4869]

 Not for into made by hands has entered holy places <the> Christ, copies of the true [ones], but into itself <the> heaven, now to appear in the presence <the> of God for us,

Greek Text:
 ἀλλ᾽ οὐχ ὡς τὸ παράπτωμα οὕτως καὶ τὸ χάρισμα. εἰ γὰρ τῷ τοῦ ἑνὸς παραπτώματι οἱ πολλοὶ ἀπέθανον, πολλῷ μᾶλλον ἡ χάρις τοῦ θεοῦ καὶ ἡ δωρεὰ ἐν χάριτι τῇ τοῦ ἑνὸς ἀνθρώπου Ἰησοῦ Χριστοῦ εἰς τοὺς πολλοὺς ἐπερίσσευσεν.

English Translation:
 But [is] not like the trespass so also the gift. If for by the of the one trespass, the many died, how much more the grace <the> of God and the gift in grace which [is] of the one man, Jesus Christ, to the many did abound!

 <the> And the God <the> of hope might fill you with all joy and peace, in <the> believing; for <the> to abound you in <the> hope in [the] power [of the] Spirit Holy.

 For having known <the> God, not as God they glorified [Him], or were thankful, but they became futile in the thinking of them, and was darkened the foolish of them heart.

English Translation:
 Like are they to little children <the> in the marketplace sitting, and calling to each other one, and says: We piped to you, and not you did dance; we sang a dirge, to you and not you did weep.

 Not for do we want you to be ignorant brothers, as to the affliction of us <the> having happened to us in <the> Asia, that against excessively beyond [our] power we were weighed, so as to despair for us even <the> to live.

 Said to them <the> Jesus, If blind you were, not then would you have sin; since however you say that, We see, the therefore sin of you remains.

English Translation:
 Greets you, Epaphras who [is] [one] of you, a servant of Christ Jesus, always struggling for you in the prayers, so that you may be stood mature and fully complete in all [the] will <the> of God.

2341. [('43_Luk.009.045', 'οἱ', 'ὁ', '<the>'), 4847]

 <the> But they were not understanding <the> declaration this, and it was veiled from them, that not they may understand it. And they were afraid to ask Him concerning <the> declaration this.

2342. [('45_Act.003.009', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4847]

2343. [('41_Mat.006.018', 'ὅπως', 'ὅπως', 'so that'), 4846]
Greek Text:
 ὅπως μὴ φανῇς τοῖς ἀνθρώποις νηστεύων ἀλλὰ τῷ πατρί σου τῷ ἐν τῷ κρυφαίῳ. καὶ ὁ πατήρ σου ὁ βλέπων ἐν τῷ κρυφαίῳ ἀποδώσει σοι ἐν τῷ φανερῷ.¶

English Translation:
 so that not may you appear <the> to men [as] fasting, but <the> to Father your the [One] in <the> secret; and the Father of you, the [One] seeing in <the> secret, will reward you in <the> public.

2344. [('44_Jhn.010.005', 'ἀλλοτρίῳ', 'ἀλλότριος', 'After a stranger'), 4844]
Greek Text:
 ἀλλοτρίῳ δὲ οὐ μὴ ἀκολουθήσουσιν ἀλλὰ φεύξονται ἀπ᾽ αὐτοῦ, ὅτι οὐκ οἴδασιν τῶν ἀλλοτρίων τὴν φωνήν.¶

English Translation:
 After a stranger however in no way not they will follow, but will flee from him, because not they know <the> of strangers the voice.

2345. [('52_Col.003.020', 'Τὰ', 'ὁ', 'you who [are]'), 4844]
Greek Text:
 Τὰ τέκνα, ὑπακούετε τοῖς γονεῦσιν κατὰ πάντα· τοῦτο γὰρ εὐάρεστόν ἐστιν ἐν κυρίῳ.¶

English Translation:
 you who [are] Children, do obey the parents in all things; this for pleasing is in Lord.

2346. [('41_Mat.003.005', 'Τότε', 'τότε', 'At that time'), 4843]
Greek Text:
 Τότε ἐξεπορεύετο πρὸς αὐτὸν Ἱεροσόλυμα καὶ πᾶσα ἡ Ἰουδαία καὶ πᾶσα ἡ περίχωρος τοῦ Ἰορδάνου,

English Translation:
 At that time were going out to him Jerusalem, and all <the> Judea, and all the region around the Jordan,

2347. [('42_Mrk.001.002', 'καθὼς', 'καθώς', 'As'), 4843]
Greek Text:
 καθὼς γέγραπται ἐν τῷ Ἠσαΐᾳ τῷ προφήτῃ· ἰδοὺ ἐγὼ ἀποστέλλω τὸν ἄγγελόν μου πρὸ προσώπου σου, ὃς κατασκευάσει τὴν ὁδόν σου ἔμπροσθέν σου.

English Translation:
 As it has been written in <the> Isaiah in the prophet: Behold, I I send the messenger of Me before face of You, who will prepare the way of You.” before of you

2348. [('44_Jhn.004.047', 'οὗτος', 'οὗτος', 'He,'), 4843]
Greek Text:
 οὗτος ἀκούσας ὅτι Ἰησοῦς ἥκει ἐκ τῆς Ἰουδαίας εἰς τὴν Γαλιλαίαν, ἀπῆλθεν πρὸς αὐτὸν καὶ ἠρώτα αὐτὸν ἵνα καταβῇ καὶ ἰάσηται αὐτοῦ τὸν υἱόν· ἤμελλεν γὰρ ἀποθνῄσκειν.

English Translation:
 He, having heard that Jesus had come out of <the> Judea into <the> Galilee, went to Him and was asking him that He may come down and may heal his <the> son; he was about for to die.

2349. [('41_Mat.006.010', 'ἐλθέτω', 'ἔρχομαι', 'should come'), 4840]
Greek Text:
 ἐλθέτω ἡ βασιλεία σου· γενηθήτω τὸ θέλημά σου, ὡς ἐν οὐρανῷ καὶ ἐπὶ τῆς γῆς·

English Translation:
 should come the kingdom of You; should be [done] the will of You, as in heaven, [so] also upon the earth.

2350. [('43_Luk.014.005', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4839]
Greek Text:
 Καὶ ἀποκριθεὶς πρὸς αὐτοὺς εἶπεν· τίνος ὑμῶν υἱὸς ἢ βοῦς εἰς φρέαρ πεσεῖται, καὶ οὐκ εὐθέως ἀνασπάσει αὐτὸν ἐν τῇ ἡμέρᾳ τοῦ σαββάτου;

English Translation:
 And answering to them He said, Which of you a son or an ox into a pit will collapse, also not immediately he will pull up him on <the> day the Sabbath?

2351. [('44_Jhn.013.033', 'τεκνία,', 'τεκνίον', 'Little children,'), 4839]
Greek Text:
 τεκνία, ἔτι μικρὸν μεθ᾽ ὑμῶν εἰμι. ζητήσετέ με, καὶ καθὼς εἶπον τοῖς Ἰουδαίοις ὅτι ὅπου ἐγὼ ὑπάγω, ὑμεῖς οὐ δύνασθε ἐλθεῖν, καὶ ὑμῖν λέγω ἄρτι.¶

English Translation:
 Little children, yet a little while with you I am. You will seek Me; and, as I said to the Jews that: Where I go, you not are able to come, also to you I say now.

2352. [('44_Jhn.007.043', 'Σχίσμα', 'σχίσμα', 'A division'), 4837]
Greek Text:
 Σχίσμα οὖν ἐγένετο ἐν τῷ ὄχλῳ δι᾽ αὐτόν.

English Translation:
 A division therefore occurred in the crowd because of Him.

2353. [('44_Jhn.006.054', 'ὁ', 'ὁ', 'The [one]'), 4836]
Greek Text:
 ὁ τρώγων μου τὴν σάρκα καὶ πίνων μου τὸ αἷμα ἔχει ζωὴν αἰώνιον, κἀγὼ ἀναστήσω αὐτὸν τῇ ἐσχάτῃ ἡμέρᾳ.

English Translation:
 The [one] eating of Me the flesh, and drinking of Me the blood, has life eternal, and I will raise up him in the last day.

2354. [('46_Rom.008.008', 'οἱ', 'ὁ', 'Those'), 4836]
Greek Text:
 οἱ δὲ ἐν σαρκὶ ὄντες θεῷ ἀρέσαι οὐ δύνανται·

English Translation:
 Those now in flesh being, God to please not are able.

2355. [('45_Act.028.021', 'οἱ', 'ὁ', '<the>'), 4835]
Greek Text:
 οἱ δὲ πρὸς αὐτὸν εἶπαν· ἡμεῖς οὔτε γράμματα περὶ σοῦ ἐδεξάμεθα ἀπὸ τῆς Ἰουδαίας, οὔτε παραγενόμενός τις τῶν ἀδελφῶν ἀπήγγειλεν ἢ ἐλάλησέν τι περὶ σοῦ πονηρόν.

English Translation:
 <the> And to him they said, We neither letters concerning you received from <the> Judea, nor having arrived any of the brothers reported or said anything concerning you evil.

2356. [('42_Mrk.002.020', 'ἐλεύσονται', 'ἔρχομαι', 'Will come'), 4834]
Greek Text:
 ἐλεύσονται δὲ ἡμέραι ὅταν ἀπαρθῇ ἀπ᾽ αὐτῶν ὁ νυμφίος, καὶ τότε νηστεύσουσιν ἐν ἐκείνῃ τῇ ἡμέρᾳ.¶

English Translation:
 Will come however [the] days when may have been taken away from them the bridegroom, and then they will fast in that <the> day.

2357. [('43_Luk.019.038', 'λέγοντες·', 'λέγω', 'saying:'), 4833]
Greek Text:
 λέγοντες· εὐλογημένος ὁ ἐρχόμενος ὁ βασιλεὺς ἐν ὀνόματι κυρίου· ἐν οὐρανῷ εἰρήνη, καὶ δόξα ἐν ὑψίστοις.

English Translation:
 saying: Blessed [is] the coming <the> King in [the] name of [the] Lord.” In heaven peace, and glory in [the] highest.

2358. [('41_Mat.015.003', 'Ὁ', 'ὁ', '<the>'), 4832]
Greek Text:
 Ὁ δὲ ἀποκριθεὶς εἶπεν αὐτοῖς· διὰ τί καὶ ὑμεῖς παραβαίνετε τὴν ἐντολὴν τοῦ θεοῦ διὰ τὴν παράδοσιν ὑμῶν;

English Translation:
 <the> And answering He said to them, Because of why also you break the commandment <the> of God on account of the tradition of you?

2359. [('42_Mrk.013.016', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'and'), 4832]
Greek Text:
 καὶ ὁ εἰς τὸν ἀγρὸν ὢν μὴ ἐπιστρεψάτω εἰς τὰ ὀπίσω ἆραι τὸ ἱμάτιον αὐτοῦ.

English Translation:
 and the [one] in the field, being not he should return to the things behind, to take the clothing of him.

2360. [('44_Jhn.005.044', 'Πῶς', 'πως', 'How'), 4832]
Greek Text:
 Πῶς δύνασθε ὑμεῖς πιστεῦσαι δόξαν παρὰ ἀλλήλων λαμβάνοντες καὶ τὴν δόξαν τὴν παρὰ τοῦ μόνου θεοῦ οὐ ζητεῖτε;¶

English Translation:
 How are able you to believe, glory from one another receiving, and the glory that [is] from the only God, not you seek?

2361. [('44_Jhn.020.019', 'Οὔσης', 'εἰμί', 'When is being'), 4832]
Greek Text:
 Οὔσης οὖν ὀψίας τῇ ἡμέρᾳ ἐκείνῃ τῇ μιᾷ τῶν σαββάτων καὶ τῶν θυρῶν κεκλεισμένων ὅπου ἦσαν οἱ μαθηταὶ συνηγμένοι διὰ τὸν φόβον τῶν Ἰουδαίων, ἦλθεν ὁ Ἰησοῦς καὶ ἔστη εἰς τὸ μέσον καὶ λέγει αὐτοῖς· εἰρήνη ὑμῖν.

English Translation:
 When is being therefore evening of the day same, the first <the> of [the] week, and the doors shut, where were the disciples assembled through the fear of the Jews, came <the> Jesus and stood in the midst, and He says to them, Peace to you.

2362. [('43_Luk.013.011', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4831]
Greek Text:
 καὶ ἰδοὺ γυνὴ ἦν πνεῦμα ἔχουσα ἀσθενείας ἔτη δεκαοκτὼ καὶ ἦν συγκύπτουσα καὶ μὴ δυναμένη ἀνακύψαι εἰς τὸ παντελές.

English Translation:
 And behold, a woman was a spirit having of infirmity, years eighteen, And she was bent over and not able to lift up herself to the full.

2363. [('46_Rom.009.018', 'ἄρα', 'ἄρα', 'So'), 4830]
Greek Text:
 ἄρα οὖν ὃν θέλει ἐλεεῖ, ὃν δὲ θέλει σκληρύνει.¶

English Translation:
 So then, to whom He wants, He shows mercy; whom now He wants, He hardens.

2364. [('51_Php.002.005', 'τοῦτο', 'οὗτος', 'This'), 4830]
Greek Text:
 τοῦτο γὰρ φρονεῖτε ἐν ὑμῖν ὃ καὶ ἐν Χριστῷ Ἰησοῦ,

English Translation:
 This for do be thinking in you which also in Christ Jesus [was]:

2365. [('67_Rev.017.011', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4828]
Greek Text:
 Καὶ τὸ θηρίον ὃ ἦν καὶ οὐκ ἔστιν, καὶ αὐτὸς ὄγδοός ἐστιν καὶ ἐκ τῶν ἑπτά ἐστιν καὶ εἰς ἀπώλειαν ὑπάγει.

English Translation:
 And the beast which was, and not is, also himself an eighth is, and of the seven is, and into destruction goes.

2366. [('44_Jhn.007.038', 'ὁ', 'ὁ', 'The [one]'), 4826]
Greek Text:
 ὁ πιστεύων εἰς ἐμέ, καθὼς εἶπεν ἡ γραφή, ποταμοὶ ἐκ τῆς κοιλίας αὐτοῦ ῥεύσουσιν ὕδατος ζῶντος.

English Translation:
 The [one] believing in Me, as has said the Scripture: Rivers out of the belly of him will flow of water living.

2367. [('44_Jhn.015.026', 'Ὅταν', 'ὅταν', 'When'), 4824]
Greek Text:
 Ὅταν δὲ ἔλθῃ ὁ παράκλητος ὃν ἐγὼ πέμψω ὑμῖν παρὰ τοῦ πατρός, τὸ πνεῦμα τῆς ἀληθείας ὃ παρὰ τοῦ πατρὸς ἐκπορεύεται, ἐκεῖνος μαρτυρήσει περὶ ἐμοῦ·

English Translation:
 When now may come the Helper, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit <the> of truth, who from the Father goes forth, He will bear witness concerning Me.

2368. [('41_Mat.009.007', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4823]
Greek Text:
 καὶ ἐγερθεὶς ἀπῆλθεν εἰς τὸν οἶκον αὐτοῦ.

English Translation:
 And having arisen, he went away to the house of him.

2369. [('44_Jhn.014.025', 'Ταῦτα', 'οὗτος', 'These things'), 4823]
Greek Text:
 Ταῦτα λελάληκα ὑμῖν παρ᾽ ὑμῖν μένων·

English Translation:
 These things I have said to you, with you abiding.

2370. [('44_Jhn.019.024', 'εἶπαν', 'ἔπω, ἐρῶ, εἶπον', 'They said'), 4823]
Greek Text:
 εἶπαν οὖν πρὸς ἀλλήλους· μὴ σχίσωμεν αὐτόν, ἀλλὰ λάχωμεν περὶ αὐτοῦ τίνος ἔσται· ἵνα ἡ γραφὴ πληρωθῇ ἡ λέγουσα· διεμερίσαντο τὰ ἱμάτιά μου ἑαυτοῖς καὶ ἐπὶ τὸν ἱματισμόν μου ἔβαλον κλῆρον.¶ Οἱ μὲν οὖν στρατιῶται ταῦτα ἐποίησαν,

English Translation:
 They said therefore to one another, Not let us tear up it, but let us cast lots for it, whose it will be, that the Scripture may be fulfilled what is being spoken: They divided the garments of Me among themselves, and for the clothing of Me they cast a lot.” The indeed therefore soldiers these things did.

2371. [('50_Eph.005.017', 'διὰ', 'διά', 'Because of'), 4822]
Greek Text:
 διὰ τοῦτο μὴ γίνεσθε ἄφρονες, ἀλλὰ συνίετε τί τὸ θέλημα τοῦ κυρίου.

English Translation:
 Because of this, not do be foolish, but do understand what the will of the Lord [is].

2372. [('41_Mat.012.024', 'Οἱ', 'ὁ', '<the>'), 4821]
Greek Text:
 Οἱ δὲ Φαρισαῖοι ἀκούσαντες εἶπον· οὗτος οὐκ ἐκβάλλει τὰ δαιμόνια εἰ μὴ ἐν τῷ Βεελζεβοὺλ ἄρχοντι τῶν δαιμονίων.¶

English Translation:
 <the> And the Pharisees, having heard, said, This [man] not casts out the demons, except only by <the> Beelzebul prince of the demons.

2373. [('45_Act.022.023', 'κραυγαζόντων', 'κραυγάζω', 'While shouting out'), 4821]
Greek Text:
 κραυγαζόντων τε αὐτῶν καὶ ῥιπτούντων τὰ ἱμάτια καὶ κονιορτὸν βαλλόντων εἰς τὸν ἀέρα

English Translation:
 While shouting out then they, and casting off the garments, and dust throwing into the air.

2374. [('44_Jhn.006.068', 'ἀπεκρίθη', 'ἀποκρίνω', 'Answered'), 4820]
Greek Text:
 ἀπεκρίθη οὖν αὐτῷ Σίμων Πέτρος· κύριε, πρὸς τίνα ἀπελευσόμεθα; ῥήματα ζωῆς αἰωνίου ἔχεις,

English Translation:
 Answered therefore Him Simon Peter, Lord, to whom will we go? declarations of life eternal You have;

2375. [('63_1Jn.003.017', 'Ὃς', 'ὅς, ἥ', 'Who[ever]'), 4820]
Greek Text:
 Ὃς δ᾽ ἂν ἔχῃ τὸν βίον τοῦ κόσμου καὶ θεωρῇ τὸν ἀδελφὸν αὐτοῦ χρείαν ἔχοντα καὶ κλείσῃ τὰ σπλάγχνα αὐτοῦ ἀπ᾽ αὐτοῦ, πῶς ἡ ἀγάπη τοῦ θεοῦ μένει ἐν αὐτῷ;¶

English Translation:
 Who[ever] now maybe may have the goods of the world, and may see the brother of him need having, and may close up the heart of him from him, how the love <the> of God abides in him?

2376. [('41_Mat.011.020', 'Τότε', 'τότε', 'Then'), 4819]
Greek Text:
 Τότε ἤρξατο ὀνειδίζειν τὰς πόλεις ἐν αἷς ἐγένοντο αἱ πλεῖσται δυνάμεις αὐτοῦ ὅτι οὐ μετενόησαν·¶

English Translation:
 Then He began to denounce the cities in which had taken place the most miracles of Him, because not they repented.

2377. [('59_Heb.008.002', 'τῶν', 'ὁ', 'in the'), 4818]
Greek Text:
 τῶν ἁγίων λειτουργὸς καὶ τῆς σκηνῆς τῆς ἀληθινῆς, ἣν ἔπηξεν ὁ κύριος, καὶ οὐκ ἄνθρωπος.

English Translation:
 in the holy places a minister, and in the tabernacle <the> true, which has pitched the Lord, and not man.

2378. [('41_Mat.010.033', 'ὅστις', 'ὅστις', 'Whoever'), 4817]
Greek Text:
 ὅστις δ᾽ ἂν ἀρνήσηταί με ἔμπροσθεν τῶν ἀνθρώπων, ἀρνήσομαι κἀγὼ αὐτὸν ἔμπροσθεν τοῦ πατρός μου τοῦ ἐν τοῖς οὐρανοῖς.¶

English Translation:
 Whoever now maybe may deny Me before <the> men, will deny I also him before the Father of Me who [is] in the heavens.

2379. [('45_Act.004.029', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4816]
Greek Text:
 καὶ τὰ νῦν, κύριε, ἔπιδε ἐπὶ τὰς ἀπειλὰς αὐτῶν καὶ δὸς τοῖς δούλοις σου μετὰ παρρησίας πάσης λαλεῖν τὸν λόγον σου

English Translation:
 And <the> now, Lord, do look upon the threats of them, and do grant to the servants of You with boldness all to speak the word of You,

2380. [('47_1Co.007.003', 'τῇ', 'ὁ', 'To the'), 4815]
Greek Text:
 τῇ γυναικὶ ὁ ἀνὴρ τὴν ὀφειλὴν εὔνοιαν ἀποδιδότω· ὁμοίως δὲ καὶ ἡ γυνὴ τῷ ἀνδρί.

English Translation:
 To the wife, the husband the debt good will should fulfill; likewise now also, the wife to the husband.

2381. [('45_Act.011.013', 'ἀπήγγειλεν', 'ἀπαγγέλλω', 'He related'), 4813]
Greek Text:
 ἀπήγγειλεν δὲ ἡμῖν πῶς εἶδεν τὸν ἄγγελον ἐν τῷ οἴκῳ αὐτοῦ σταθέντα καὶ εἰπόντα αὐτῷ· ἀπόστειλον εἰς Ἰόππην ἄνδρας καὶ μετάπεμψαι Σίμωνα τὸν ἐπικαλούμενον Πέτρον,

English Translation:
 He related then to us how he had seen the angel in the house of him, having stood and having said, to him do send forth to Joppa, men and do yourself send for Simon, who is called Peter,

2382. [('51_Php.001.025', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4811]
Greek Text:
 καὶ τοῦτο πεποιθὼς οἶδα ὅτι μενῶ καὶ παραμενῶ πᾶσιν ὑμῖν εἰς τὴν ὑμῶν προκοπὴν καὶ χαρὰν τῆς πίστεως,

English Translation:
 And this having been persuaded of, I know that I will remain and will continue with all of you for <the> your progress and joy of the faith,

2383. [('41_Mat.011.028', 'Δεῦτε', 'δεῦτε', 'Come'), 4810]
Greek Text:
 Δεῦτε πρός με πάντες οἱ κοπιῶντες καὶ πεφορτισμένοι, κἀγὼ ἀναπαύσω ὑμᾶς.

English Translation:
 Come to Me, all you who [are] toiling and burdened, and I will give rest to you.

2384. [('43_Luk.006.023', 'χάρητε', 'χαίρω', 'do rejoice'), 4808]
Greek Text:
 χάρητε ἐν ἐκείνῃ τῇ ἡμέρᾳ καὶ σκιρτήσατε· ἰδοὺ γὰρ ὁ μισθὸς ὑμῶν πολὺς ἐν τῷ οὐρανῷ. κατὰ τὰ αὐτὰ γὰρ ἐποίουν τοῖς προφήταις οἱ πατέρες αὐτῶν.¶

English Translation:
 do rejoice in that [very] <the> day, and do leap for joy; behold for, the reward of you [is] great in <the> heaven. According to these things of them for were treating the prophets the fathers of them.

2385. [('41_Mat.001.022', 'Τοῦτο', 'οὗτος', 'This'), 4807]
Greek Text:
 Τοῦτο δὲ ὅλον γέγονεν ἵνα πληρωθῇ τὸ ῥηθὲν ὑπὸ τοῦ κυρίου διὰ τοῦ προφήτου λέγοντος·

English Translation:
 This then all has come to pass, that may be fulfilled that having been spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,

2386. [('52_Col.002.010', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'and'), 4807]
Greek Text:
 καὶ ἐστὲ ἐν αὐτῷ πεπληρωμένοι, ὅς ἐστιν ἡ κεφαλὴ πάσης ἀρχῆς καὶ ἐξουσίας·

English Translation:
 and you are in Him completed, who is the head of all rule and authority,

2387. [('44_Jhn.001.018', 'Θεὸν', 'θεός', 'God'), 4806]
Greek Text:
 Θεὸν οὐδεὶς ἑώρακεν πώποτε· ὁ μονογενὴς θεὸς ὁ ὢν εἰς τὸν κόλπον τοῦ πατρός, ἐκεῖνος ἐξηγήσατο.

English Translation:
 God no one has seen ever yet; the only begotten God, who is being in the bosom of the Father, He has made [Him] known.

2388. [('45_Act.007.034', 'ἰδὼν', 'εἴδω', 'Having seen,'), 4806]
Greek Text:
 ἰδὼν εἶδον τὴν κάκωσιν τοῦ λαοῦ μου τοῦ ἐν Αἰγύπτῳ καὶ τοῦ στεναγμοῦ αὐτῶν ἤκουσα· καὶ κατέβην ἐξελέσθαι αὐτούς· καὶ νῦν δεῦρο ἀποστείλω σε εἰς Αἴγυπτον.¶

English Translation:
 Having seen, I saw the oppression of the people of Me <the> in Egypt, and the groans of them I have heard, and I have come down to deliver them; and now come, I may send you to Egypt.’

2389. [('41_Mat.016.004', 'γενεὰ', 'γενεά', 'A generation'), 4805]
Greek Text:
 γενεὰ πονηρὰ καὶ μοιχαλὶς σημεῖον ἐπιζητεῖ· καὶ σημεῖον οὐ δοθήσεται αὐτῇ εἰ μὴ τὸ σημεῖον Ἰωνᾶ τοῦ προφήτου. καὶ καταλιπὼν αὐτοὺς ἀπῆλθεν.¶

English Translation:
 A generation evil and adulterous, a sign seeks, and a sign not will be given to it, except only the sign of Jonah. <the> prophet And having left them, He went away.

2390. [('42_Mrk.007.009', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4805]
Greek Text:
 καὶ ἔλεγεν αὐτοῖς· καλῶς ἀθετεῖτε τὴν ἐντολὴν τοῦ θεοῦ ἵνα τὴν παράδοσιν ὑμῶν στήσητε.

English Translation:
 And He was saying to them, Neatly do you set aside the commandment <the> of God, that the tradition of you, you may maintain.

2391. [('44_Jhn.010.031', 'Ἐβάστασαν', 'βαστάζω', 'Took up'), 4805]
Greek Text:
 Ἐβάστασαν οὖν πάλιν λίθους οἱ Ἰουδαῖοι, ἵνα λιθάσωσιν αὐτόν.

English Translation:
 Took up therefore again stones the Jews, that they may stone Him.

2392. [('42_Mrk.012.042', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4804]
Greek Text:
 καὶ ἐλθοῦσα μία χήρα πτωχὴ ἔβαλεν λεπτὰ δύο ὅ ἐστιν κοδράντης.

English Translation:
 And having come, one widow poor cast [in] lepta two, which is a kodrantes.

2393. [('42_Mrk.005.021', 'Καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4803]
Greek Text:
 Καὶ διαπεράσαντος τοῦ Ἰησοῦ ἐν τῷ πλοίῳ πάλιν εἰς τὸ πέραν συνήχθη ὄχλος πολὺς ἐπ᾽ αὐτόν, καὶ ἦν παρὰ τὴν θάλασσαν.¶

English Translation:
 And when was crossing <the> Jesus in the boat again to the other side, was gathered a crowd great to Him, and He was beside the sea.

2394. [('45_Act.014.004', 'ἐσχίσθη', 'σχίζω', 'Was divided'), 4803]
Greek Text:
 ἐσχίσθη δὲ τὸ πλῆθος τῆς πόλεως, καὶ οἱ μὲν ἦσαν σὺν τοῖς Ἰουδαίοις, οἱ δὲ σὺν τοῖς ἀποστόλοις.

English Translation:
 Was divided now the multitude of the city, and some indeed were with the Jews; some however with the apostles.

2395. [('41_Mat.022.005', 'οἱ', 'ὁ', '<the>'), 4802]
Greek Text:

English Translation:
 <the> And having paid no attention they went away, that [one] on one hand to <the> [his] own field, that [one] however to the business of him.

2396. [('42_Mrk.005.032', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4801]

 καὶ περιεβλέπετο ἰδεῖν τὴν τοῦτο ποιήσασαν.¶

English Translation:
 And He was looking around to see the [one who] this having done.

2397. [('44_Jhn.015.010', 'ἐὰν', 'ἐάν', 'If'), 4800]
Greek Text:

English Translation:
 If the commandments of Me you shall keep, you will abide in the love of Me, as I, the commandments of the Father of Me have kept, and I abide of Him in the love.

2398. [('45_Act.002.017', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4800]
Greek Text:

English Translation:
 And it will be in the last days, says <the> God, I will pour out of the Spirit of Me upon all flesh; and will prophesy the sons of you, and the daughters of you; and the young men of you visions will see, and the elders of you dreams will dream;

 during [the] high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, came [the] declaration of God upon John, the <the> of Zechariah son, in the wilderness.

English Translation:
 and <the> most of the brothers, in [the] Lord already trusting by the chains of me, more abundantly to dare fearlessly the word <the> of God to speak.

Greek Text:

English Translation:

2405. [('42_Mrk.004.032', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'and'), 4796]
Greek Text:

English Translation:
 and when it may be sown, it grows up and becomes greater than all the garden plants, and it produces branches great, so that to be able under the shadow of it the birds of the air to perch.

 And immediately having stood up before them, having taken up [that] on which he was lying, he departed to the home of him, glorifying <the> God.

 After now were fulfilled these things, purposed <the> Paul in the Spirit, having passed through <the> Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, having said that, After <the> being my there, it behooves me also Rome to see.

 but as it has been written: What eye not has seen, and ear not has heard, and into heart of man not has entered, what has prepared <the> God for those loving Him.”

 About however the promise <the> of God, not he did waver <the> through unbelief, but was strengthened <the> in faith, having given glory <the> to God,

 I am the bread which is living, <the> from <the> heaven having come down; if anyone shall have eaten of this <the> bread, he will live to the age; and the bread also that I will give, the flesh of Me is which I I will give for the of the world life.

 At that [very] <the> time went <the> Jesus on the Sabbaths through the grainfields, <the> and the disciples of Him hungered, and they began to pluck [the] heads of grain and to eat.

 which some professing, from the faith went astray. <the>  Grace [be] with you [all] Amen to Timothy first. it was written from Laodicea which is capital of Phrygia, <the> of Pacatiana

2434. [('46_Rom.012.002', 'καὶ', 'καί', 'And'), 4781]

English Translation:
 <the> And Jesus not He did permit him, but He says to him, do go to the home of you, to <the> your own, and do declare to them as much as the Lord for you has done and had mercy on you.

2438. [('43_Luk.006.036', 'Γίνεσθε', 'γίνομαι', 'do be you'), 4778]

English Translation:

2439. [('59_Heb.004.003', 'Εἰσερχόμεθα', 'εἰσέρχομαι', 'We enter'), 4778]
Greek Text:
 Εἰσερχόμεθα γὰρ εἰς τὴν κατάπαυσιν οἱ πιστεύσαντες καθὼς εἴρηκεν· ὡς ὤμοσα ἐν τῇ ὀργῇ μου· εἰ εἰσελεύσονται εἰς τὴν κατάπαυσίν μου· καίτοι τῶν ἔργων ἀπὸ καταβολῆς κόσμου γενηθέντων.

English Translation:
 We enter for into the rest, those having believed; as He has said: So I swore in the wrath of me, Not will they enter into the rest of Me.’” and yet the works from [the] foundation of [the] world have been finished.

2440. [('41_Mat.009.016', 'οὐδεὶς', 'οὐδείς', 'No one'), 4777]
Greek Text:
 οὐδεὶς δὲ ἐπιβάλλει ἐπίβλημα ῥάκους ἀγνάφου ἐπὶ ἱματίῳ παλαιῷ· αἴρει γὰρ τὸ πλήρωμα αὐτοῦ ἀπὸ τοῦ ἱματίου, καὶ χεῖρον σχίσμα γίνεται.

English Translation:
 No one however puts a patch of cloth unshrunk on clothing old; tears away for the patch of it from the garment, and a worse tear emerges.

2441. [('41_Mat.026.033', 'Ἀποκριθεὶς', 'ἀποκρίνω', 'Answering'), 4777]
Greek Text:
